awd_titl_txt: Honors Psychology Courses:  A Workshop for High School      Teachers
awd_abstract_narration: This four-week summer workshop sponsored by Texas A&M                           University will provide an intensive course in psychology                       for 32 teachers who will be offering the new AP psychology                      program.  The course will cover all areas typically included                    in a college introductory psychology course, with particular                    emphasis on research methods, in neuropsychology, cognition,                    and sensation/perception.  Additional coverage will include                     demonstrations, experiments, simulations, and other                             activities that can be used to illustrate the principles and                    phenomena of psychology; the development and utilization of                     a microcomputer laboratory as an adjunct to or as a                             significant part of the high school course; making the                          psychology of gender and ethnicity a significant part of the                    introductory course; the format and content of the AP exam;                     and information on planning in-service activities, including                    production of a model in-service program for honors                             psychology.  Staff for the summer workshop consists of high                     school and college psychology teachers selected for their                       content expertise, their excellence in teaching, and their                      skills in in-service training.                                                                                                                                  Matchinig funds from the schools and Texas A&M University                       are 14% of the NSF grant.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
